concept_data.title: case-law
concept_data.category_name: sources and branches of the law
concept_data.category_full: 1206 sources and branches of the law

summary: The term "case-law" refers to the body of judicial decisions that interpret and apply legal principles within the European Union's legal framework. It plays a pivotal role in shaping EU law, as courts, particularly the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU), establish precedents that guide future legal interpretations and regulatory applications. Case-law ensures consistency and coherence in the application of EU legislation across member states, influencing not only national courts but also the development of new legal standards. As a vital source of law, case-law reflects the dynamic interplay between legal norms and judicial interpretation in the EU context.
